page.title: 01Larbax, North of Portpatrick
page.content: The area is coastal with a rocky sandy shoreline. To the west lies the North Channel, the hills of Ireland visible on the horizon. Inland are grassy rolling hills. Fresian cattle dominate the scene with sheep overwintering from places with a less amenable climate. Trees are scarce, those that grow, lean away from the periodic westerly gales. Occasional mists roll in from the sea enveloping all in a damp softening cover persisting at times for several days. The coastal area is of archaeological interest. A fort once stood here with burial places, both now represented by grassy mounds. Habitations amounting to no more than 2 dozen, are evenly spaced. No village as such is here. The few inhabitants are mainly concerned with dairy farming.
